member.name: T:BizUnit.TestSteps.DataLoaders.File.FileDataLoader
member.summary: The FileDataLoader maybe used to load a file from disc and passed to a test step or sub-step which accepts a dataloader. Test steps which use data loaders benefit from increased flexibility around how they load data by de-coupling the test step from how it loads its data.

member.name: P:BizUnit.TestSteps.DataLoaders.File.FileDataLoader.FilePath
member.summary: The file path of the file to be loaded by the FileDataLoader

member.name: T:BizUnit.TestSteps.DataLoaders.Xml.XmlDataLoader
member.summary:
The XmlDataLoader maybe used to load a file from disc and passed to a test step or sub-step which accepts a dataloader. The XmlDataLoader enables the contents of the data to be modified, for example a node containing a reference number could be XPath'd and set to a value that was previously set in the context. This gives greater flexibility around the data that is loaded into test steps.
An example usage of this might be as follows: A test needs to be created to test a web service that fetches the status of a trade, however before this can be done a new trade needs to be created since a unique bookingReference is required. The test therefore is created in two parts, first it books a new trade using the bookTrade service, the bookingReference is set in the test context using the XmlValidationStep. Next the test calls the getTradeStatus web method, it loads the request body from disc using an XmlDataLoader which in turn sets the value in the body of the request message to the value of bookingReference previously set in the test context.

member.name: P:BizUnit.TestSteps.DataLoaders.Xml.XmlDataLoader.FilePath
member.summary: The file path of the data to be loaded

member.name: P:BizUnit.TestSteps.DataLoaders.Xml.XmlDataLoader.UpdateXml
member.summary: A collection of XPathDefinition's to be applied to the data fetched from FilePath

member.name: T:BizUnit.TestSteps.ValidationSteps.Xml.XmlValidationStep
member.summary: The XmlValidationStep validates an Xml document, it may validate against a given schema, and also evaluate XPath queries. The Xpath query is extended from XmlValidationStep to allow Xpath functions to be used which may not return a node set.
member.remarks:
The following shows an example of the Xml representation of this test step.
.\TestData\PurchaseOrder.xsd urn:bookstore-schema
PONumber_0
Tag Description
XmlSchemaPath The XSD schema to use to validate the XML data (optional)
XmlSchemaNameSpace The XSD schema namespace to validate the XML data against (optional)
XPathList/XPathValidation XPath expression to evaluate against the XML document (optional)(repeating).

member.name: M:BizUnit.TestSteps.ValidationSteps.Xml.XmlValidationStep.Execute(System.IO.Stream,BizUnit.Core.TestBuilder.Context)
member.summary: ITestStep.Execute() implementation
member.param: The stream cintaining the data to be validated.
The context for the test, this holds state that is passed beteen tests
